name: Cia. de Saneamento de Minas Gerais (COPASA)
description: Cia. de Saneamento de Minas Gerais, commonly known as COPASA, is a public utility company based in Brazil, dedicated to providing water supply and sewage services to the state of Minas Gerais. Established in 1970, COPASA operates under a concession from the state government, serving a population of over 10 million people. The company is committed to sustainable practices and aims to improve the quality of life for its customers through the provision of reliable and efficient sanitation services. COPASA has invested significantly in infrastructure projects to enhance its service coverage and efficiency, ensuring that clean water is accessible and that waste is treated responsibly. The company has also focused on implementing innovative technologies and practices to promote environmental sustainability. COPASA is listed on the B3, the Brazilian stock exchange, and is recognized for its transparency and commitment to corporate governance. The company's mission is to provide high-quality services while promoting social and environmental responsibility.
